structure.unit: Courts, Judicial Officers And Proceedings In Civil Cases

law.catch_line: Unsatisfied Judgments; Expiration Of Time For Taking Out Executions; Remedies
law.text: If a judgment remains unsatisfied after the expiration of the time for taking out execution thereon, the creditor may obtain a new execution by motion to the court in which such unsatisfied judgment was rendered, or he may at any time after the judgment, subject to section twenty of chapter two hundred and sixty, bring a civil action thereon.
